headline.main: PLAN $1,000,000 HOTEL.; New Structure for White Plains to Have Many Novel Features.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: WHITE PLAINS, N.Y., March 13. -- It was reported at White Plains to-day that a new hotel to cost $1,000,000 will be erected at Hartsdale, near White Plains, by a syndicate, and that it will be one of the finest in the world. Four hundred acres have been acquired, beginning at the Hartsdale railroad station, near the Scarsdale Golf Club grounds.
docs.snippet: WHITE PLAINS, N.Y., March 13. -- It was reported at White Plains to-day that a new hotel to cost $1,000,000 will be erected at Hartsdale, near White Plains, by a syndicate, and that it will be one of the finest in the world. Four hundred acres hav...

headline.main: THE RAINES LAW.; Mr. Funk Dissents from Views of Its Would-Be Amenders.

docs.abstract: I K Funk scores proposed amendments to NYS Raines law that regulates Sunday liquor sales in hotels and saloons, lr
docs.lead_paragraph: The Brewers' Association, the Committee of Fourteen, and others have agreed, if I am told correctly, to urge at Albany that the present Raines law be so amended as (1) to eliminate the compulsory bedrooms feature -- a most corrupting convenience; (2) to increase the license fee for Raines hotels, and (3) to grant local option to cities as a whole.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Chicago Tribune complains of Chicago's lack of what it calls "first-rate hotels," splendid houses like a half dozen or more of the renowned modern hotels of New York, which themselves are supposed to attract visitors from all parts of the country. As a political convention city and a great business centre.

headline.main: SUING SUBSCRIBERS TO HOTEL NOT BUILT; Office Building Put Up on Fifth Avenue Site Where the Brunswick Was to Be. $500,000 WAS NOT PAID IN Knickerbocker Trust Company Brings the Suits -- Subscribers Balk at Shift in Plans.

docs.abstract: Knickerbocker Trust Co, Brunswick Hotel Co stock subscriber, sues co for failing to build planned hotel; office bldg was built on site instead
docs.lead_paragraph: Suit has been begun by the Knickerbocker Trust Company through its attorneys, Davies, Stone Auerbach, against several subscribers in the Brunswick Hotel Company for the collection of nearly $500,000 unpaid subscriptions, in that enterprise.
docs.snippet: Suit has been begun by the Knickerbocker Trust Company through its attorneys, Davies, Stone  Auerbach, against several subscribers in the Brunswick Hotel Company for the collection of nearly $500,000 unpaid subscriptions, in that enterprise....

headline.main: HOTEL AFFRONTS SENATOR'S SISTER; Mrs. Frank of Baltimore, Sister of Isidor Rayner, Told That Jews Are Not Wanted. SOUGHT ROOMS FOR NIECES She Resents the Affront by Leaving the Marlborough-Blenheim at Atlantic City.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.abstract: Mrs B Frank, sister of US Sen I Rayner, leaves Marlborough-Blenheim Hotel, Atlantic City upon being told that hotel does not give guest privileges to Jewish patron
docs.lead_paragraph: ATLANTIC CITY, N.J., May 17. -- Mrs. Bertha Rayner Frank of Baltimore, sister of United States Senator Isidor Rayner of Maryland, left the Marlborough Blenheim Hotel suddenly on Wednesday on hearing that Jews were not desired as guests. The information was imparted to her when she applied for accommodations for two nieces who were about to visit her.
docs.snippet: ATLANTIC CITY, N.J., May 17. -- Mrs. Bertha Rayner Frank of Baltimore, sister of United States Senator Isidor Rayner of Maryland, left the Marlborough Blenheim Hotel suddenly on Wednesday on hearing that Jews were not desired as guests. The inform...

headline.main: SEVEN MILLIONS BUILT THIS HUGE HOTEL PILE; Ten Stories of the Latest Luxury in Hotel Astor. COVERS FOURTEEN CITY LOTS Has More Than 500 Bedrooms and the most Recently Invented Safeguards Against Fire, Bad Air, and All Forms of Discomfort.

docs.lead_paragraph: When the ten-story Hotel Astor opens its doors, early in the Fall, nearly $7,000,000 will have been spent by William Waldorf Astor for the land, the construction, and the furnishings. The building alone will represent a cost of about $5,000,000. The land is valued at more than $1,000,000. The movable furniture will cost nearly $700,000.

headline.main: HOTEL FOR WOMEN ONLY; Accommodations for 650 in the Martha Washington. Business and Professional Women as Stockholders and Tenants of the Structure.

docs.lead_paragraph: Holders of the stock of the Woman's Hotel Company received notice yesterday that the Hotel Martha Washington, at 129 East Twenty-ninth Street, a hostelry built by that company for use by women, is to be ready for inspection to-day. The capital of the company, which was incorporated in this State in March, 1900, is $400,000, divided into 4,000 shares of $100 each.

headline.main: NEW HOTEL BRUNSWICK ON MADISON SQUIRE; Arrangements for a Twenty-Story Structure Complete. The Land for the Site Figures at $2,750,- 000 and the Building at $4,750,000 -- Knickerbocker Trust Company Active in the Deal.

docs.lead_paragraph: Negotiations involving the old Hotel Brunswick site took such form yesterday as to justify an announcement on the part of the promoters of the enterprise, and this announcement is that a twenty-story hotel will be erected on the property, and that work upon it will be begun on May 1. 1903.
